title: Publish Draft Version 33 live and provide low-cost domain setup walkthrough

requirements.text: Publish the currently deployed Draft Version 33 to live/production by executing the production deployment checklist (build + deploy backend and frontend to the IC network) and recording the results.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend and frontend canisters are deployed to the IC network using `dfx build ... --network ic` and `dfx deploy ... --network ic` as per `frontend/PRODUCTION_DEPLOY_CHECKLIST.md`.
Verification is completed for both the direct canister URL (`https://<canister-id>.ic0.app`) and the custom domain URL (if configured) per `frontend/PRODUCTION_DEPLOY_CHECKLIST.md`.
A complete deployment log is captured using `frontend/DEPLOYMENT_LOG_CAPTURE_TEMPLATE.md` (date/time, operator, commit hash, DFX version, and full command output).

requirements.text: Complete and expand the domain walkthrough documentation so it fully walks a user through low-cost domain options and connecting a purchased domain to the deployed frontend canister (DNS + IC custom domain mapping), including concrete DNS record examples and where to find the frontend canister ID.

quotes: And walk me thru those options please.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/DOMAIN_SETUP_GUIDE.md` is updated so it does not end mid-step and includes: how to retrieve the frontend canister ID (e.g., `dfx canister id frontend --network ic`), the required DNS records with example values, and the high-level IC custom domain mapping steps.
The guide explicitly covers price-conscious registrar options already listed (Namecheap, Porkbun, Cloudflare, etc.) and includes a short checklist emphasizing renewal price and WHOIS privacy.
All user-facing documentation text is written in English.

requirements.text: Complete the production go-live runbook so it is actionable end-to-end (it currently stops at “Environment Check”), including environment validation steps, the exact deploy commands to run, and post-deploy verification steps (ic0.app URL and `https://clearing.icp0.io`).

quotes: And walk me thru those options please.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/PRODUCTION_GO_LIVE_RUNBOOK.md` includes the missing sections after “Environment Check”, with step-by-step commands aligned with `frontend/PRODUCTION_DEPLOY_CHECKLIST.md`.
Runbook includes explicit verification steps for: access-code gate (code: `1122`), booking CTA, footer visibility, and no invisible clickable areas at page bottom.
Runbook includes a short troubleshooting pointer that references the existing checklist troubleshooting section and `frontend/DEPLOYMENT_NOTE_clearing-icp0-io.md`.

constraints: Respect the single-actor backend architecture; all Motoko logic remains in `backend/main.mo` unless a state migration is truly required.
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any path listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not add third-party auth providers; only Internet Identity is allowed.
nonGoals: Implementing new product features unrelated to publishing/go-live (e.g., new booking flows, new Stripe features, new UI sections).
Adding external databases or non-IC hosting/deployment targets.
Purchasing a domain automatically through the app (domain purchase remains manual via registrar websites).
